meanings.definition: An enzyme that breaks down thiamine.
meanings.sent1: The thiaminase in the food caused the thiamine to break down quickly.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied how thiaminase affects the breakdown of thiamine in different foods.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous chef added extra thiaminase to the recipe, turning the dish into a thiamine breakdown experiment.
meanings.sent4: The thiaminase worked like a tiny demolition crew, breaking down the thiamine molecules one by one.
meanings.sent5: In the presence of thiaminase, thiamine vanished as if it were under a magical spell.

meanings.sent1: The presence of thiaminase in the food led to the destruction of thiamine content.
meanings.sent2: Health experts warn about the harmful effects of consuming foods with high levels of thiaminase.
meanings.sent3: The thiaminase villain in the story stole all the thiamine, leaving the characters without their energy source.
meanings.sent4: The thiaminase acted like a thiamine terminator, obliterating all traces of the essential nutrient.
meanings.sent5: The thiaminase's mission was clear: to eradicate every bit of thiamine it encountered.
